description: CHANGE OF USE FROM A1  (RETAIL GROCERY STORE) TO A3 (RESTUARANT)
decision_conditions: Reason : 1 - The use of the site as an A3 cafe use at this location, by reason of its design, appearance and layout is considered to a; have a negative impact on the attractiveness, viability and vitality of this designated secondary shopping frontage within Mitcham Town centre, b; have a negative impact on adjacent neighbour amenity through increased noise and disturbance c; fail to provide a safe layout for users of the development and neighbouring residents above the site and d; the applicant has failed to demonstrate the provision of adequate facilities for users of the premises and means of ventilating and extracting the premises, in accordance with Sites and Policies Plan (2014) policies DM R4 and DM D2

Reason : 2 - The cafï¿½ entrance and London Rd frontage shop front by reason of design and appearance fail to enhance the public realm through high quality urban design or to provide an active frontage with a window display with direct access from the shopping frontage and therefore has a negative impact on the appearance, character, vitality and viability of the premises and wider Mitcham Town centre contrary to policies DM D2, DM D7 and DM R4 of the adopted Merton Sites and Policies Plan 2014 and policies CS2 and CS 14 of the Merton Core Strategy 2011

Reason : 3 - INFORMATIVE
Note to Applicant
In accordance with paragraph 38 of the NPPF, The London Borough of Merton  (LBM) takes a positive and proactive approach to development proposals focused on solutions. LBM works with applicants/agents in a positive and proactive manner by:
"	Offering a pre-application advice and duty desk service. 
"	Where possible, suggesting solutions to secure a successful outcome.
"	As appropriate, updating applicants/agents of any issues that may arise in the processing of their application.
In this instance:
"	The application was considered to be fundamentally contrary to the provisions of the Development Plan and the NPPF, and there were not considered to be any solutions to resolve this conflict. 
"	It is noted that the applicant/agent did not engage in any pre-application discussions.
"	The applicant is advised to seek pre-application advice on any resubmission.
